Reviews.Title: “Good location, quirky design and adequate service”
Reviews.Author: S_Valmont
Reviews.Content: This interesting hotel in the 6th arr is well located and fun. The combination of older furniture and original elements combined with new colorful and tasteful ecclectic design makes it good option for people who are bored with ubiquitous corporate or outdated hotels. The rooms are somewhat small, but that's normal for Paris. There is a small desk next to the bed, but it can barely hold more than a laptop. The bathroom was quite spacious and like the rest of the hotel in very good condition. Wifi was also free (request access codes at the reception). Other facilities are quite limited (no coffee maker in the room and such), but that is to be expected for this type of hotel in Paris. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel (but I almost never do in hotels). Service was at least adequate and sometimes was quite good. We requested a room with a bath through e-mail and received it without any problems and getting tea, plates and cups late in the evening was no problem at all. The location is one of the main reasons I picked the hotel. Metro/RER stops are a few minutes away, everything is relatively close by. Although the direct area isn't that exciting (but safe and nice), you have enough great options for whatever you want to do within 10-15 minutes by foot. One of the only real faults I could find was the lack of a luggage storage room and the way the hotel (at least the person at the desk at the time) manages that fact. Suitcases left in storage at the hotel are lined up next to the reception desk. When we asked if they couldn't be stored in a secure location, the response (given with typical Parisian attitude) was "I'll be here all the time, our guests can be trusted and you can always take your suitcase with you if you aren't satisfied". All in all we were quite happy with our stay and I am definitely willing to return here if the price is right (I was able to get a discount, the normal prices might be a tad steep if you aren't used to hotel prices in Paris).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: SmaRt1904
Reviews.Content: We had a superb stay. Small but modern rooms. Quiet street. Very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly well kitted out hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: icemandan
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a long weekend. Arrived late at night due to late train (Tip - if travelling from Gare du Nord take the RER to Luxembourg not the Metro to Odeon). Room was a little on the small side but tastefully decorated. Comfortable bed and no disturbance. Strange double door arrangement to get into room but meant that no noise came in from the landing. Lots of cafes and restaurants round about and Pantheon, Monge, Botanic Gardens, Ile de France and Musee d' Orsay all walkable. Very enjoyable stay. We went to nearby cafes for breakfast - the Cafe Soufflot on the road to the Pantheon is the pick of the bunch - Le Fournil - a little bakery/sandwich shop on Rue Monsieur le Prince is the budget option. Only minor grumble - the lift is absolutely minute.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice with excellent location and tasteful design”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel near Jardin d\u Luxembourg in the St. Germain area, with restaurants and shopping nearby. Very close to the RER train station (direct from CDG airport) and walking distance to the Odeon metro station. My room was very clean and it was newly renovated. The bed was extremely comfortable. The only problem was that it was on the ground floor near the reception, so it could be very noisy at times with the foot traffic (esp the high heels!) outside of our door. Just avoid that room. Hotel staff was mostly friendly. There were some confusion/debate over the room rate but it was resolved eventually. Just be aware that if they indicate single room for 1 person on the website, they really meant it for 1 person only, even if the room has 2 twin beds and can well fit 2 people. They will argue to charge you 30 euros extra per person per night, which is excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, certainly worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Melissaberry
Reviews.Content: Ive been there three times now. Twice before it had it's renovation, and one after, and each time I have been impressed. Its such a lovely boutique hotel. Now it has been done up, it is enchanting and you feel special staying there. The decor is beautiful, with the lovely court yard and a charming renovated basement where you have breakfast. The room are modern, clean and large with equally good bathrooms. The service is great, people are very helpful and friendly. It's also in a very lovely area of Paris, so as soon as you walk out the door, your in beautiful Paris. It's in walking distance of pretty much all the best parts of Paris to go. Overall, it's probably not the cheapest place to stay, but it is worth the little extra, and you get a wonderful experience and a magical place to stay. This place is what staying in Paris should be like.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff, Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Robert B
Reviews.Content: I travel three weeks a month. And, I found Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg exceptional. Not only was the hotel clean, recently remolded and comfortable, but more importantly, the staff could not have been more helpful. It was a great value for the money. And, it is close to many great attractions and loads of very good restaurants. I will undoubtedly stay here on my next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with friendly staff - above Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: Lulgiss
Reviews.Content: We had room 101, very spacy, quite, with highceiling and huge and high quality bed. Bathroom with shower and tub. Rooms have double doors, so privacy is guarantied and given the central location, we heard almost nothing, not even the ambulances, but had no view. We staid Thu and Fri nights for 260€ / nite. French style breakfast - dont expect too much, but when you eat as you are supposed to in the evening, a simple coffee will do. We went down both days and had 1st day coffees en 2nd day 1 breakfast + 1 coffee. They charged 14€ for the breakfast and 6€ for the coffees. No other extra. Wifi available though not all ports are open.

Reviews.Title: “quirky, and great location”
Reviews.Author: amsW6
Reviews.Content: A charming hotel, and a fantastic base from which to explore Paris. It's within walking distance of the Eiffel tower (we meandered there in about 40mins), Notre Dame is on the doorstep, and there are plenty of tourist and less touristy restaurants nearby. Very comfortable beds. Minimalist storage (a funky clothes rail and tin desk), but a useful room safe. Good, clean bathroom with large shower. Small grocery store just over the road, which was helpful. The only negative about our room was that our neighbour's bathroom noises were transmitted so clearly to us! The lift is comically small and sometimes the night lights in the corridors didn't work which was slightly precarious given that there are some random steps. The reception staff were pleasent and helpful. We'd happily come back & would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pjay99
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on internet ratings (like trip advisor). Overall a good choice. Decent clean room. A little compact but that is typical for EU cities. Looks like it has had a recent renovation. Very nice people at the front desk. Helped my locate restaurants and directed me around. No fussing with my terrible French, they speak English without complaint. Breakfast is average Europe bread and yogurt for about 14EU. This is an ok price compared to what I got on the street the first day. Good location for walking everywhere. The Luxembourg park is across the street and a great first stop or get up early and join the 100s of joggers going around the park. I gave it average because it is basic, no luxury or specialness, just a good place to bed in Paris. P

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel... but I wouldn't stay there again”
Reviews.Author: MarySP
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and beautiful, rooms are extremely well decorated, staff is courteous, location is good (not excellent). Breakfast (NOT included in the room rate) was very expensive, overpriced at 14 euros per person for just a couple of breads, 2 types of cheese and boiled eggs. I booked a room for 3 people and got a very big and spacious room in the ground floor. My first concern with this room was the big sky window that didn't have any curtains. Surprisingly, this was the smallest problem of the room. This room was right across the room from the elevator, so people stopped to chat while waiting for the elevator all night long, making it impossible for me to get any sleep. The other problem is that this room was adapted for disabled people (which we weren't), so it had a shower with no curtains and a bath with no shower. Next day we asked to be transferred to another room. The new room was on the first floor, and much smaller, although we paid the same price. Again, it was very beautiful and well decorated. Bathroom was nicer, it had a closed shower, although it didn't have a bath. But it barely fitted the extra-bed (we were in 3 people) and it was conjugated to another room, so we could hear every single word they said in the next room. Of course it didn't help they were very loud Italians with a small baby that cried most of the time. Location, as I said, was good, but not great. It's very well and centrally located between Luxembourg Garden and Sorbonne University, Notre Damme Cathedral, but the nearest subway station was about 3-4 blocks away. I know it doesn't sound bad, but I've stayed in other cheaper hotels in Paris where you had a subway station just around the corner, so this one was a little disappointing. But the main issue and reason why I wouldn't go back there was really with the noisy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: stasiahansen
Reviews.Content: Late sommer days in Paris with wide opento the street tall french windows and breakfast served in bed. Luxembourg garden with hundreds of heavy metal chairs in green just q couple of steps away. Thank you Zina, Marat, Alex and the rest of you for a unforgatable stay in the city of all cities! Br A&T

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: MrstheGhost
Reviews.Content: This is a petite gem in a fabulous position. It's close to all the major attractions, quiet and elegant. The rooms are quite spacious for Paris, the decor is gorgeous and the staff are friendly, helpful and outstanding in their service. A perfect hotel for wheelchair travellers (be sure to request a disabled-friendly room - there are only two).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & we'll most definitely be back...!”
Reviews.Author: Marc N
Reviews.Content: We've just arrived back in the UK. Had an amazing time in Paris & so pleased that we booked this hotel. The location is fantastic, the hotel is a mixture of modern & vintage with quirky character, which we loved. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The staff were very friendly & very helpful, the breakfast was lovely, everything about this hotel was fantastic and we both highly recommend the Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg! We look forward to returning soon. Marc & Helen

Reviews.Title: “Rooms tiny but excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Nonblondie
Reviews.Content: Let's get the negative out of the way first. The room we had was very tiny (but understandably it is Paris!) and we had to put our luggage under the bed to make room to walk. The room was however, well furnished and very clean throughout. The towels were very thin but the shower was excellent. We were very impressed with the level of service provided by the reception staff especially the manager during the day who gave us a lot of recommendations about booking into a show and he even saved us 40 euros by not charging their commission when he helped booked us into one! We had breakfast in the hotel once and thought it was a rip off to charge 14 euros per person but we didn't have a choice due to early morning commitments. But upon check-out, we were surprised and delighted that the young lady at reception was really nice and said not to worry about it and they won't charge us for the breakfast. It was a very nice gesture and we were very grateful. The location of the hotel is fantastic - there is a really nice bistro a few doors away at the corner that serves the best duck steak with home made frites that I would love to have again. It is walking distance to many attractions and about 5-10mins to the nearest metro station. There is a coin laundrette on Rue Monsieur Le Prince to make it all the better. We would probably stay here again but will get a larger room next time!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful little boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: owl_hoho
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights and we were upgraded to a superior room on top floor. Comfy beds and nice clean bathroom, with tub and robes! We had breakfast once at the hotel, which was ok but expensive for what you get. Better to go to a cafe and you can get it for half the price. Great location so we walked everywhere only took the metro when we arrived and when we left! Service was great and we do not have anything to complain about and will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Lovely introduction to Paris”
Reviews.Author: ejh397
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with four friends during the weekend of the Paris marathon. It was an excellent base to view the city. The hotel has a small and charming feel. It is decorated in a contemporary style with very pretty bedrooms and luxurious bathrooms. We had two adjoining rooms with king sized beds and a fold up bed was provided for the 5th guest. The rooms were spotless and the staff friendly and helpful. There was no restaurant or bar but the hotel is in the heart of the Latin Quarter. There were restaurants to cater for all tastes on the doorstep. It was also only a short walk to Luxembourg metro station and the adjoining park.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: talgad
Reviews.Content: simply great hotel in a great locations. realy beautiful rooms, the pictures don't do justice with it. realy clean beautiful bathroom, the rooms are in parisian size - a bit small. hope to get back realy soon.

Reviews.Title: “Place to stay if you want to be central”
Reviews.Author: JWoolouse
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel, comfortable and quiet. Close to the Sourbonne and only 10-15 minutes walk from Notre Dame. Room was quite small, but think this is to be expected in France generally. Bathroom well kitted out, but no shower curtain so wet floor every time you shower. Only grumble was no tea making facilities in room, but again probably to be expected. Didn't sample breakfast which was €14 per head, rather turn right out of hotel door and walk to Suisse cafe on the corner so you can sit on the pavement opposite the Palace Du Luxembourg and watch the world go by as you enjoy your coffee and croissant. Spent 3 comfortable nights, relaxing environment close to some very nice small restaurants - try the Polidor just around the corner for authentic french dining experience, apparently they have not accepted credit cards since 1845 so take some cash! Would recommend this hotel as a reasonably priced place to stay convenient to some of the major tourisme areas.

Reviews.Title: “'chambre superior' very cramped indeed”
Reviews.Author: irishtravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a good location, breakfast was good - and very nice waiter too. Bed was firm and comfortable.Very effective double-glazing and good black-out curtains. Room lighting and colours very muted in style of many contemporary boutique hotels, but the dim lighting meant poor visibility and was inconvenient. There was no room-service despite a room-service menu in the room. We phoned reception to request a hot drink but were told there was no one available to provide it. We paid for a superior room but it and the shower-room were very small. However, the water pressure in the compact shower- cubicle was good. The bath towels were very thin. There was no place to put luggage and no proper wardrobe, just open hangers. If you were travelling with a lot of luggage or even two largish suitcases, it would be very difficult to find space for them. We put one under the bed and the other under a table at the window. If you wanted to open the window you had to move the table. There was no luggage rack probably because there was absolutely space for it! Overall very disappointing because so cramped. We paid for a 'chambre superior' and expected a little more space despite the fact that hotel rooms in Paris are small.

Reviews.Title: “For anyone who would like to be immersed in a quiet neighbour and be a local Parisian for a few days”
Reviews.Author: Marlao
Reviews.Content: We travelled during the low season of Paris and got a rather good non-cancellable rate from booking.com. The hotel was close enough to the Luxembourg RER station, straight from CDG airport. However finding the hotel was a little bit challenging (especially on a rainy day) as it was tugged in a quiet side street. We were attracted to the history of this hotel when deciding to book and were not disappointed. The room was small but it was usual in the heart of Paris. There were interesting original thick old wooden beams on the top floor (see attached picture). Staff were lukewarm but not a concern for us since we didn't need to have much interaction. Everything was straight forward and there was free wifi in the room which was perfect (you would need to get a password from the reception for every piece of equipment). Overall it was a good stay in Paris, except for the rainy weather!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for a nice price”
Reviews.Author: JoeR11
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on the Tripadvisor Paris travel guide mentioning it under budget hotels. We were not disappointed. Upon booking, they charged a very small deposit and checkout was simple and we were charged the agreed-upon price (even though they upgraded our room (to accommodate some other guests)). The location was good if you want to be just a little off the beaten path. It was a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame with nice cafe's and restaurants along the way. There was a great little convenience store right across the street where we got 2 liter water bottles for 23 euro-cents apiece. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. We did not have breakfast there since it was expensive and The Croissanterie was right down the street. The elevator really is tiny - as in only two suitcases and one person maximum. The internet (wifi) connection was free and worked fine. The beds and pillows were great - very comfortable to both me and my wife. The only problem we had sleeping is that the walls are thin just like in most hotels we stay in domestic and foreign. Also, our upgraded room had a maid closet right outside the door and the staff was extremely noisy in accessing it one night. All in all, though, it was a great hotel experience and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanMarket
Reviews.Content: Nice, small hotel in a wonderful neighborhood. Easy to walk to shops and restaurants. Close to RER stations and bus stops. Just down the block from Luxembourg Gardens and Senat. Our room and bathroom were a good size for Paris. Only problem was the lighting in the room was not great. Hard to see since the lighting didn't really do its job. Same situation in bathroom. Very good continental breakfast. And, Alex, working the front desk is very helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “C'est superb!”
Reviews.Author: ennui80
Reviews.Content: I took a girlfriends' trip to Europe with 2 of my friends for my 30th birthday. We were pleasantly surprised at how beautiful it was inside. The tiny elevator only fit one of us and our suitcase in at a time. Fortunately, we were on the second floor, so we took the steps a lot. We got one of the smaller, narrow rooms that had 2 twin beds (that we separated from each other), and a rollaway bed was also brought in... so for 3 girls with lots of stuff, it was tight quarters... but we figured it's Paris and we didn't plan on spending that much time in our room! All three beds were very comfy though and the room itself was beautiful! The bathroom was very nice and the shower was great! We didn't hear the other guests at all and the lobby was always peaceful. The window in our room was huge (we faced the street) and we opened it to let a nice breeze in... consequently hearing the neighborhood drunk who liked to argue with the buildings outside when he was not passed out on the sidewalk. Although we tried to avoid walking by him, we found him to be quite amusing. We liked the location of the hotel... we could walk almost anywhere we needed to. Its proximity to Jardin du Luxembourg, Notre Dame, the Louvre, and the subway was great. We ate at the bistros or picked up quick bites from the patisserie or market across the street. Of the 4 people at the front desk, 3 of them were really great and helpful and would point us to possible places to eat and help us set up some excursions with the Tourist office. There was only one guy there that didn't seem to understand much English (and all three of us tried to speak in broken French so we did make as much effort as we could... didn't want to be rude Americans!). But other than that, our stay at the hotel was great! AND it was the only one we stayed in that offered free WiFi... BONUS! Out of the 4 cities we visited, I'd say this hotel was the most European and the one we loved the most, despite it being the smallest room we stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Look at the price they gave you”
Reviews.Author: tinyhunter
Reviews.Content: The hotel in general view is nice, rooms a bit small, but clean and comfortable. Location is great, as it close to the Luxembourg Parc and can be reached easely via the RER B directly from the CDG. The real downside is that the price for the room changed from Sat - Sun even though we had a fixed price. No comment, no discussion, no care. Shame as otherwise the hotel is nice. With that check the prices you get and be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel...fantastic stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DaveiWashington_DC
Reviews.Content: You just cannot beat the location...just a block from the Odeon on the left bank of the Seine. Enjoy shopping, great little restaurants and galleries galore, just outside your door. Rooms are small, but the bathrooms are well appointed. Our room opened out to an inner courtyard and was quiet. We did not have a closet and a few hooks for coats would have been nice. Hotel staff varied greatly. Two of the 3 staffers we dealt with were FANTASTIC... knowledgable and helpful. The third, who worked Sunday daytime, was a dud. He was of no help at all about the local area or even how to work the hotel lobby's coffee machine. Poor training here.... The other negative was total lack of any English-language television stations on the cable TV in rooms. They had some 20+ French stations....and no BBC, CNN, TCM....nada. TIP: take the RER from CDG Airport...use the St. Michel station and you are only 2 blocks from the hotel. Save yourself the taxi fare and you might even save time. Also, just 20 feet from the front door of the hotel is a cute and fab little restaurant/bar that is not to be missed...Au Pere Louis. Book a seat for dinner and you'll find a bargain and some terrific local French food...please try the Cassoulet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: M_G017
Reviews.Content: Nicely appointed rooms, and some staff were friendy. However, when we booked a double superior room directly with the hotel, requesting a quiet room away from the elevator, they accepted our reservation but did not deliver. Our room was in the middle of the hotel lobby, and was next to the elevator and stairs! Hardly what was requested. Asking for a quiet room, the only room availabe was a standard double, which should have cost about $70 less for the 2 night stay. Unfortunately, they refused to provide a reduction at checkout, saying that the only person authorized was the Director. After my first e-mail went unanswered, I phoned the Director, but he said he could do nothing as the bill had alrady been paid. Talk about a catch-22! Once they have your money it's gone! After a long debate, he did offer a discount on our next visit, but I am not ready to give them my money again. Advice - don't stay in room 011, and don't trust them!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel for business or leisure travelling”
Reviews.Author: Tatiana9-2010
Reviews.Content: Excellent location; quiet, clean and beautifully decorated hotel; standard rooms little bit smaller than in the US, but nice and the space was sufficient for two people in a room; superior rooms are larger and comparable for US hotels rooms; staff was nice and wiling to help. Shops and cafes are close; subway stations in 5-10 min walking distances; the beautiful Luxembourg garden is in 2 min walking distance; many other sightseeing sites are close. If you like walking, the majority of main sightseeing places in the central part of Paris are in a walking distance. Would be nice to have a coffeemaker in rooms; they don't which was typical for Europe. The entire stay was absolutely positive.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: Wills0515
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with our decision to stay at Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg! The hotel is in a fantastic location near the Luxembourg Gardens and the Boulevard St. Michel, near metro stops, and in walking distance of attractions such as Notre Dame. It has been beautifully renovated- our room was very pretty and our bathroom was impressively large for a European hotel. The hotel does offer breakfast but its rather expensive and not anything special. There are tons of cafes and patisseries nearby to try instead. The staff was helpful at calling for dinner reservations for us. Our favorite place for dinner was Au Pere Louis just steps from the hotel. Also, there is a nice convenience store right across the street for snacks and water. We would happily stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Everything we wished for and more!!”
Reviews.Author: mytimenow
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay at this lovely hotel you will not be disappointed. Everything about it was simply excellent for the price it really delivered! Excellent location, we could see the corner of the Luxembourg Gardens from our window! Fairly quiet location and with the double glazed windows it was perfect for a good nights sleep. The decor is crisp and clean and interesting with the huge murals behind the bed! Bed was bit hard for my liking but my partner disagreed and loved the bed. Crisp white linens to sleep under and very comfortable pillows which were a delight after other places this trip! The bathroom was lovely, an enormous bath that fitted us both with lovely clean tiles and nice toilettries. Little grocery shop directly over the road, pastry shop around the corner, excellent little wine bar on the corner up the top of the street - very sophisticated and not noisy! Fabulous restaurant right next door that we ate at - hardly any tourists and the food was beautiful French flavours and reasonably priced - 3 courses 2 persons plus drinks under 135 Euros. The staff were always helpful and very polite. The room was the basic double and it was an excellent size - big enough for us not to trip over our 2 large suitcases and the bathroom was enormous by European standards! Rooms were cleaned and in very good condition with what appears to be a very new refurbishment. We loved our stay and will definitely return next visit! Cannot recommend highly enough - we walked everywhere and could get home in a flash on the metro. Plus the free wifi was a bonus and not at all difficult to use in your rooms! Book this hotel and you will not regret it I promise.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Jasperoo
Reviews.Content: My husband says that this hotel has ruined him for all of Europe - that he is never happy now because nothing lives up to the standard at Hotel Fontaines du Luxombourg! The rooms are small (aren't they always in Europe) but beautifully appointed. The bathrooms are gorgeous with good showers (so important on holidays). The bed was soft and perfect for a good nights sleep after treking around Paris and the rooms are quiet. The staff are very friendly and helped with taxis back to the airport as well as really good restaurant reservations. I cannot recommend this hotel enough - great place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: andybaum
Reviews.Content: Our stay was pleasant and trouble-free, although I wouldn't give the hotel the raves that others have. It's a little quirky: very nice terry bathrobes, but no washcloths and only one teeny soap. Big comfortable bed, but extremely poor bedside lighting. Excellent concierges during the week but grumpy unhelpful ones during the weekend. A nice coffee bar off the lobby, but an overpriced 3 euros for a single espresso. And the mediocre cold breakfast at 14 euros is a poor value. Better to go to the boulangerie and cafes around the corner. One hint: instead of booking through the online program I sent an email directly to the hotel. We got a prompt, courteous response and a better rate than what was posted. The location is fabulous: a block from Luxembourg Gardens, a block from the Boul'Mich, and less than ten minutes walk from the Seine. The prices are reasonable. There is a mini-grocery across the street so you can easily buy the soap and bottled water that is unavailable in the hotel. We enjoyed our stay, but it probably won't make our list of all-time favorites.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic! Excellent price/quality ratio! Would recommend it highly!”
Reviews.Author: CLARAetFAMILLE
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a three-nite stay at Fontaines du Luxembourg. What an extraordinary place -- gorgeous & spacious rooms and bathrooms, well-equipped, comfortable and extremely clean, really well located (a few steps away from St-Germain des Près, the Latin Quarter and the Jardin du Luxembourg) and courteous and friendly staff. We adored our stay. We had the family room and it was just perfect for our family - two separate bedrooms although connecting, each with a very large bathroom (one with a shower and one with a bath) - our 8 and 18 year old sons were in the connecting room and my husband and I felt extremely comfortable with them closeby but yet in their separate room. We highly recommend this beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: nrusso
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in this hotel for two nights in May and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The location is great, very close to Luxembourg Gardens, a metro station and a laundromat. The rooms are clean, well-appointment and stylish. The bathrooms were excellent, no problems with water temperature or pressure. The breakfast was great with fruit salad, cereal, cold meats, bread, cheese, coffee and tea. The staff were incredibly helpful and polite, on the first night they helped us with our Moulin Rouge booking and on our last night they found a lovely vegetarian restaurant for us within walking distance. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “A clean comfortable secure welcoming haven”
Reviews.Author: Willowbee2
Reviews.Content: First, the bad news. The rooms are on the small side and therefore have little wardrobe/storage space. I did not find this to be a big problem others may disagree. The staff are friendly, welcoming, engaging, helpful and efficient. The hotel is spotless. The beds are very comfortable. The bathrooms are excellent and well supplied. The hotel is peaceful and calming. The lounge is a comfortable and amenable place to relax. The only thing that would make this hotel perfect would be a small fridge in the room but there is one in the ground floor kitchen that you can use. The location is perfect with the Luxembourg Gardens a minute away and plenty of places to eat and drink etc. including a small supermarket directly opposite the front door. If you are coming to Paris then come here.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE”
Reviews.Author: jandb22
Reviews.Content: First, my apologies to the hotel & staff for not writing our review sooner. My wife & I stayed at this boutique hotel the last week in May and required their wheelchair accessible room. Our room, located on the 1st floor, was good size,particularly by European standards. Clean,comfortable,great location. The extraordinary staff was totally helpful & accommodating. Room had huge roll in shower with shower seat, wall mounted shower head as well as hand held. Grab bars all around. Hotel's entrance/exit is accessible from sidewalk; electric eye sliding doors. Breakfast was worth the price & staff was kind enough to bring our meal from the inaccessible dining area to our room or lobby area. There is a convenience store across the street for snacks, drinks, fruit.. Near cafes, restaurants, transportation. Very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: sunrisecarib
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 wonderful nights. Had one of the bigger rooms. Large king bed that was super comfy. Location is perfect. 24 hrs desk assistance. My only complaint s that the cleaning lady was a little loud in the morning. Our room was right next to the linen closet. Would recommend this hotel for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, probably won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: trvl09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in July. We loved the location and the staff were quite nice to me when I spoke french to them but not nearly as friendly to my partner who only speaks english. We stayed in a Junior Suite which while large seems to share a small corridor with the room the maid uses to clean all the rooms on the floor. This is quite unfortunate as to access the corridor you have to open a door which closes quite loudly and then to go into the housekeepers room there is another door which closes loudly as well. This all started about 8:30 every morning and never failed to wake us up and keep waking us up. It also sounded as if someone was trying to come into our room because the closing of those doors would shake our door as if someone was trying to get in. The elevator is also TINY - you can fit one person and 1 piece of luggage in it -- we just took the stairs but to get the bags in and out of the room we had to take a few trips. The rooms are quite basic, even the Junior Suites don't have a mini-refrigerator. There is a bar size refrigerator in the kitchen downstairs which guests have access to along with plates, cutlery, glasses, wine bottle openers, etc. We really liked this neighborhood. There were lots of restaurants very close by, the Jardin de Luxembourg was across the street and you could walk to all the sites from here. Having such a large landmark close by made it easy to get back if we ever took a taxi. The hotel is also close to public transportation and one day we took the metro out to Versailles and it was very easy. For the money you will spend staying here I would look for another hotel in a similar neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “romantique and fantastique”
Reviews.Author: leafandpetal
Reviews.Content: I went with my boyfriend for a surprise trip away, the hotel staff where very friendly and happy to help with any queries. The hotel was clean and well cared for and had a funky modern decor. Our room was a good size for the two of us and the bathroom was lovely. The hotel is perfectly located in a quiet street - amazing considering a 5 minute walk will take you into the busy streets of the latin quarter We didn't eat in the hotel purely down to the fact we were only there for a couple of days and were keen to try out some recomended restaurants and cafes. I do agree with the comments of the lift being tiny, it was hilarious trying to squash ourselves and the luggage into it, but it's not a huge hotel so using the stairs wasn't a problem for us. The massive Jardin du Luxembourg is a short walk away if you want to escape the bustle of Paris, the metro is about a 10 -15 min walk from the hotel and there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. This is a quirky hotel in a fantastic location, go there if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: ClaireJessica
Reviews.Content: We had a 4 night stay at Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg in July. When we arrived, Paris was in the midst of a mini-heatwave, so it was great that our room had air-con! The rooms were bigger than I was expecting, which was good (especially for Paris!), and the bathroom was a decent size. The only downside was that the shower was over the bath and had no screen, so you either had to have a bath or get water all over the floor! The location was fabulous - right in the heart of the left bank, walking distance to the Pantheon, Notre Dame, St. Germain des Pres and right across the road from the beautiful Luxembourg Gardens. Odeon metro is a 3 minute walk away and there are heaps of great restaurants right near the hotel. The staff were very helpful and the lobby is lovely - there is a big area where you can sit and watch TV or read newspapers. We didn't try the breakfast (as it was 11 euros per person). Instead we went to Les Editeurs down the road each morning ( they had lovely crossaints!). The only other thing I can think to mention is that if you're not a fan of lifts, you probably won't want to get in the one at Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg! It is TINY (barely enough room for one person and their luggage) so we opted instead to climb the stairs to our room on the fourth floor. All in all though, a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Good location to explore Paris.”
Reviews.Author: californiafamily2010
Reviews.Content: Tough to find room for a family of four in Paris... so we had to get two adjoining room so it made our stay quite expensive. There's little market and a ATM across the street from the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to many locations and not far from the River Seine.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Experience ... Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: MoppelOhio
Reviews.Content: A hidden jewel !! Terrific, central location to explore one of the most charming areas of Paris - hidden away in a quiet street Newly renovated, very appealing interior design (from our perspective) - check out the pics. Each room is different - see design comment Rooms are sizable for Paris standards (incl. bathrooms) Air conditioning in each room (yes, a very American comment) Very helpful concierge and staff Many excellent restaurants in easy walking distance. We will return the next time we are in the neighborhood. Oh, by the way: the price was right too....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NurseGirl76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. We have stayed in several hotels in Europe and this is one of our favorites. The staff was friendly and helpful. The decor was contemporary and beautiful. Our room was perfect: neat, comfortable, and large for european standards. We did not experience anything negative during our stay. We especially loved the central location. It is close to the metro and the lively area of Paris for night time.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I hoped for.”
Reviews.Author: Schleins Girl
Reviews.Content: Pros: Decor, cleaness. Cons: Lack of hot water, broken elevator, really poor breakfast. Not that close to a Metro. I looked forward to my stay at the hotel for months, and I left so disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: hatstand1
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with all aspects of the hotel. Our room (the one that is the main photo on the website - a double superior) was roomy, with a large bath and lovely interior decoration. The location is perfect - walking distance to Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay (15 min walk) and the lovely St Germain area. We spent most of our time in the immediate area as food, shopping and general atmosphere were so good. Service was good - English happily spoken & very helpful with requests. Only minor negative was breakfast which was fine but not great (however at 14 euro is not expensive like a lot of hotels) - but I would recommend going to Le Petit Suisse at the end of the street.

Reviews.Title: “secret place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: smos
Reviews.Content: Completely renovated hotel in 2009 situated at 200 metres from Jardins de Luxembourg. As a single travelling to Paris for a congress i was really surprised about the room : 20m² with a large bed , flatscreen TV, fast free Wifi and a huge clean bathroom with a very large bath. I really recommend this hotel for his very good price/quality.

Reviews.Title: “believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: Percy13
Reviews.Content: The other reviews are so good that i was slightly suspicious that they were fake (we recently stayed in a grotty b&b in switzerland with a bunch of stunning reviews), but this hotel thoroughly deserves all of the praise it has been getting. I doubt you will find anything better for the price in such a great part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location - minuscule room”
Reviews.Author: onholiday1o1
Reviews.Content: Fab location - right next to the Jardin du Luxembourg, and close to several good cafes and restaurants (Le Comptoir was excellent, down the hill in Opera, and the La Ferrandaise next to the hotel was good too). In the heart of St Germain - which means walking distance to great shopping - fashion, books, antiques; the islands, up to Bastille etc. Large, open reception, with plenty of sofas and a TV to loaf in front of. Pleasant front of house. Get a wifi password when you check in (although it seemed to drop out about every 15 minutes for us). We were in room 401. Whilst it was super-clean and stylishly fitted, it was dark and tiny, and I mean, really tiny. Kind of diamond-shaped, with lots of opportunities for banging knees and heads on bed corners and TVs. Gorgeously fitted shower-room - all rich brown tiles and ceramic lights. No bar or fridge. Little room for hanging up long items like trousers and dresses (but plenty of hangers). The bed was high tho, so your suitcase could be stored underneath. Didn't try the breakfast (at 14€), went to local cafes instead, inc nearby les editeurs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HeikeWien
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in the hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg. The whole staff in the hotel was very polite and helpfull. The room was modern, clean and big enough for the three of us. The bathroom was very nice, big and comfortable. The hotel has been renovated one year ago and therefor everything looks very new and stylish. The location of the hotel is very central and next to all the highlights of Paris. We will come back to this hotel again and can recommand it without any doubt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ssze_902
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. The hotel is very clean and beautiful. Location is pretty good, just 5 mins away from RER station and 10 mins from metro. The room size is ok, cannot expect much in Paris. I will come back and stay in this hotel again. The lady at the reception desk is very helpful, showing us how to use the metro, and direction.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jdhnyc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel with my fiancee and we loved it! hotel was renovated spring/fall 2009 and is in immaculate condition. staff was great and always helpful. this is a wonderful location next to the Luxembourg Garden and the St. Germain area with easy access to anywhere else in Paris. terrific restaurants in the neighborhood with several within one block of the Hotel (Au Pere Louis, La Ferrandaise, Bastide Odeon, Le Rostand (coffee shop)). Would definitely go back again and would recommend it to all types of visitors. A few things I would note. First, the room we stayed in (double superior with king size bed) had no closet, only a quasi-armoire to hang clothes in. thus, we kept most of our clothes in our travel suitcases. Second, there was no shower curtain/door so every morning we had a soaked bathroom floor (bathroom was very sizable by the way). Finally, breakfast at the hotel was 14 euros per person which may be a bit steep just for coffee, juice, cold cereal, croissants, but it was convenient so we used it 3/4 of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_london123
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our recent stay at Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg. The hotel is well cared for, fashionably decorated, clean and nice. It is one of the larger rooms I have had in Paris (we had a double room, the single rooms looked to be quite small). It is a very quiet hotel on a nice side street but just steps away from the hustle and bustle of St. Germaine and the Latin Quater. Also a stone's throw away from the Gardens. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Unique & very nice”
Reviews.Author: ibeenthereandthere
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. I thought the design in the foyer area was wonderful and the rooms were clean and well catered for. It had a nice feeling about it and i slept like a baby! This is a great location if you want to explore restaurants around St.Germain and of course the fabulous Jardins Du Luxembourg. A really nice part of Paris and not over ran with tourists. Only drawbacks: - rooms were a bit dark and slightly naff- they would be wonderful if they painted them a lighter colour! hint hint - breakfast is OK but at 13 euros you'd be better off grabbing it on the run or in a cafe I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “what a value!”
Reviews.Author: flfishinchick
Reviews.Content: I researched long and hard for a hotel for our first trip to Paris. I nailed this one! I had read/heard that hotel rooms were small and expensive in Paris. When I looked into this hotel and the prices were so affordable, I decided to upgrade us to a junior deluxe suite! The room was beautiful and the bathroom was large. Our only complaint (we being Floridians and used to air conditioners that freeze you!) was that, you guessed it, we couldn't seem to cool off our room for sleeping. We could, however, open our windows because it was quiet. EVERYONE who worked the front desk was very helpful--especially with dinner suggestions! We didn't eat the breakfast (in fact, we never even saw where it was!) because there are so many cafes and restaurants so close to the hotel. We loved the location. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Paris - we love you!”
Reviews.Author: dkfamily2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely little hotel for 4 days. Located in a relatively quiet street, so you do not notice that you are staying in the middle of Paris. Located only 300 meters from the RER Luxembourg (Ligne B to the airport). We were excited about how it would go with our daughter 1 ½ years. It went really well and the hotel staff was always very helpful. Breakfast was good. The hotel is very well positioned for attractions and shops. Everything is within walking distance. There is only one thing to say and that is that this hotel deserves all the praise that others have given on this site. This is among our best hotel experiences!!

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Petersh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this nice hotel for six nights. The weather was bad all week. But the newly renovated hotel was perfect and located next to the lovely Jardin du Luxembourg and the latin quarter. We stayed in the junior suite and it was very spacious. Though the breakfast buffet was small it was excellent. The staff was very friendly and helpful - and we will definitely stay here the next time we are in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AmberZurich
Reviews.Content: As a solo traveller you are quite often faced with the fact that you pay a lot, but get poor rooms and/or service. It is also difficult to find in a capital city nice rooms to a decent price. I must say, Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg matched all my criteria: - clean - nice room, big enough for one person - very nice service - decent price I was very happy and will choose the same hotel for my next stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable friendly hotel, even nicer since refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: lancashirecat
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel in a good location, just opposite the Gardens of Luxembourg, and. central for shopping and site seeing. We have stayed here several times before, but now the hotel has been refurbished and is very 'chic'.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with tasteful decor and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: KayW_10
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after several searches on trip advisor. This is a real gem of a hotel where from the moment we arrived we were made to feel very welcome and nothing was too much trouble. Our room was a good size with good decor and a lovely bathroom. Location is good with a very good restaurant a couple of doors away. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of cafes close by where we could sit and people watch! We really liked this hotel and would certainly recommend and book again when we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MennoTrapman
Reviews.Content: A nice room, comfortable bed, clean and spacious bathroom, good breakfast, perfect location an very nice people!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room, lovely painting on the wall”
Reviews.Author: NellyParis
Reviews.Content: I loved the decoration of the room, a nice painting on the wall, the light blue and brown , the hotel is entirely renovated and comfortable. The bathroom is modern and very clean. The hotel lobby, welcoming with it's bookcase , television and large sofas. We appreciate the calm in the hotel and in the street and in the same time, very close ( 3 minutes walk) to restaurants and shopping streets.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Fontaines du Luxembourg
HotelInfo.Address: 4 rue de Vaugirard | 6th Arr., 75006 Paris, France
